833432782356431.title: Research Scientist Intern, Soft Wearable Tactile Sensors (PhD)
833432782356431.responsibilities: Research and develop the next generation of soft wearable technologies. Collaborate with the larger Reality Labs team and provide creative solutions to challenges in soft wearables and sensing technologies. Design, prototype, and characterize novel wearable, acoustics-based sensors. Emphasis on fundamental scientific and engineering questions related to the complex deformation of soft wearable technologies. Communicate or publish research activities and findings to collaborators across a variety of disciplines.
833432782356431.minimum_qualifications: Currently in the process of obtaining a PhD degree in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Applied Physics, Robotics or relevant technical field 2+ years experience with hardware prototyping, soft wearable technologies, and hands-on experience including but not limited to soft transducers design, manufacturing and characterization Systematic thinking, cross-group collaboration, clear communication Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
833432782356431.preferred_qualifications: Demonstrated experience via an internship, work experience, or widely used contributions to open source projects Knowledge of ultrasonics-based non-destructive evaluation Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as first-authored publications at leading workshops or conferences and journals such as Science & Nature family of Journals, PNAS, Physical Review Letters, Advanced Materials, Advanced Functional Materials, Experimental Mechanics, Extreme Mechanics, SES, SEM, ICTAM, ASME, MRS, APS, Phononics, or similar Experience working and communicating cross functionally in a team environment Availability for minimum 16 consecutive week internship Intent to return to the degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
833432782356431.compensation: $7,313/month to $12,134/month + benefits Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. 837627411947285.location: Burlingame, CA • New York, NY • Full Time
837627411947285.responsibilities: Interact directly with FDA and/or indirectly with international regulatory agencies on most projects/products at reviewer level. All significant issues will be reviewed with the manager Support regulatory compliance activities, including site registration, audits, post-market vigilance reporting, product recalls, etc., as needed Prepare FDA, European and Canada submissions for product changes as required to ensure timely approval for market release. Review significant regulatory issues with manager, as necessary, and resolve submission issues with engineering partners, geography regulatory partners, and regulatory agencies as needed Prepare regulatory strategies/plans and compliance requirements. Provide on-going support to project teams for regulatory issues and questions

837627411947285.preferred_qualifications: Master’s Degree in Regulatory Affairs Extensive knowledge of applicable regulations, standards and guidance for medical devices (MDR, MEDDEV, MDCG, IMDRF, FDA QSR, SaMD, cybersecurity, ISO 13485, ISO 14971, IEC 62304, etc.) Technical expertise in software development practices and how to communicate with SW engineers to get required regulatory deliverables Experience with development and regulations for medical devices intended for direct to consumer health wearables RAPS RAC Certification

1494662195191120.title: Display System Engineer
1494662195191120.location: Sunnyvale, CA • Redmond, WA • Full Time
1494662195191120.responsibilities: Drive the design and integration of full binocular display systems, including optics, mechanics, calibration, and system interfaces Define sub-system requirements with the product team, then deliver AR/VR hardware, software, and calibration that meets specifications. This may include: hardware (optics, electronics, mechanics, silicon, sensors, data communication), software (computer vision algorithms, calibration, modeling, analysis), and performance analysis Resolve requirements discrepancies and ensure alignment across all engineering disciplines Drive cross-functional engagement with partners to develop concepts and prototypes into manufacturable product hardware Collaborate with product, hardware, software, calibration, integration, and validation teams to deliver AR/VR hardware that meets specifications Lead design verification, testing, and troubleshooting to correlate with optical modeling, metrology, and system performance Influence technical direction and strategy across the organization Mentor and develop engineers and cross-functional partners
1494662195191120.minimum_qualifications: MS or BS in Engineering, Physics, Optics, or related field, or equivalent work experience 10+ years of experience in developing complex optical systems, with at least 5 years in a technical leadership role 5+ years of experience and knowledge of optics three or more of the following: systems design and integration, imaging, illumination, radiometry and photometry, physical and geometric optics, statistics, and polarization Demonstrated expertise in binocular display system design and integration Experience on shipping products with advanced optical systems Collaboration experience and influencing skills
1494662195191120.preferred_qualifications: Experience with full product life cycle launches in AR/VR or wearable display systems Familiarity with display calibration functions and graphics pipelines In-depth knowledge of display optical requirement definitions, characterization and performance optimization

3982151508715631.title: SEO Europe – Market Specialist, Israel
3982151508715631.responsibilities: Work as part of the Europe team, enforcing on crisis response within the region Work as part of an On-call Operational structure to enforce on critical content within SEO Markets with a higher focus on Israel Leverage a combination of language proficiency and Israeli market geopolitical knowledge, along with an understanding of local nuances and minority communities, to capture signals and insights that inform the enforcement and resolution of intricate risk and operational issues within the region Scope scalable solutions to improve the support of our community of users in the market and in partnership with other regions Investigate and resolve issues that are reported on Meta products, such as requests for account support and reports of potentially abusive content including but not limited to graphic images, videos and text, offensive or derogatory language, and other objectionable material Support enforcement efforts on agnostic content that originates from multiple sources globally where language expertise is not required Support enforcement efforts identifying integrity risks to our local and regional advertising business and enforce on these risks Support region wide programs of work supporting peak season buying initiatives, protecting advertisers, businesses and removing friction in the ad delivery process Analyze key metrics and collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve our processes and tools Build subject matter expertise around abuse areas prevalent in the region and work with the team on enforcement efforts to manage and control impacts Investigate emerging risk across the region and influence cross functional resolution. Provide input and support on policy recommendations using geopolitical as well as operational understanding with cross-functional partners Liaise closely with our Meta vendor teams to ensure all operational KPIs meet and exceed targets and work collaboratively to improve processes and tools and scale solutions Remain up to date on key workflow changes, operational guidelines, policy updates and our Community Standards Support the training and onboarding of Meta partners
3982151508715631.minimum_qualifications: Bachelors degree and/or Masters or equivalent experience Professional working proficiency in Hebrew and extensive knowledge of U.S. Israeli diaspora is essential as this role will involve working on issues in these languages as well as dealing with external clients in that market 1+ years of professional experience within an operations environment Experience communicating with a variety of audiences and stakeholders from the Israeli market Experience in successfully navigating projects that demand situational analysis and informed decision-making, often involving the evaluation of unclear or ambiguous factors Interest in supporting the Facebook and Instagram community Effective communication and collaboration skills while working closely with cross-functional teams Self-starter with experience of operating in a time-sensitive, ever changing environment
